body:
Mediation sessions are run by professionals who help you try to reach an agreement without going to court.

Mediation isn’t relationship counselling and you don’t have to be in the same room as the other parent.

Mediation is suitable for people who want to reach an agreement but need help from someone who is independent.

## The difference between mediation and a MIAM

Mediation isn’t the same as a MIAM.

A MIAM is an introductory meeting that explains how mediation can help resolve your dispute. You’re legally required to attend a MIAM if you want to go to court, unless  [you’re exempt]({app:urls:url:miams-exemptions}).

!abbr:MIAM!
